gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.desc: How to access and navigate the platform

steps.s1: Access the platform via your browser and click 'Sign In'. Choose your profile (Student, Professor, or Admin) and enter your credentials.
steps.s2: After login, you'll be directed to the Dashboard with an overview of your rooms, courses, and groups.
steps.s3: Use the sidebar menu to navigate between Dashboard, Rooms, Reports, and Administration (based on your role).

steps.s1: Professors can create rooms by clicking 'New Room' on the Dashboard, selecting a group and scenario.
steps.s2: Each room contains a PBL scenario, chat, whiteboard, timer, and evaluation tools.
steps.s3: Students access rooms automatically through the 'Rooms' section after login.
steps.s4: The professor can control the session flow through the 8 PBL steps (Opening â†’ Synthesis).

steps.s1: In Admin > Scenarios, create scenarios with title, content, tutor glossary, and guiding questions.
steps.s2: Use AI generation to automatically create scenarios from a topic.
steps.s3: Associate scenarios with rooms and control release to students in real-time.

session.title: Tutorial Session (8 Steps)
session.desc: Complete flow of the 8 PBL steps

steps.s1: Step 1 â€” Opening: Scenario presentation and initial problem reading.
steps.s2: Step 2 â€” Unknown Terms: Identification and recording of terms needing clarification.
steps.s3: Step 3 â€” Problem Definition: Clear formulation of the central problem to investigate.
steps.s4: Step 4 â€” Brainstorming: Generating hypotheses and ideas about the problem.
steps.s5: Step 5 â€” Learning Objectives: Defining objectives to guide individual study.
steps.s6: Step 6 â€” Individual Study: Period for research and deepening on objectives.
steps.s7: Step 7 â€” Synthesis / Closing: Sharing findings and final discussion.
steps.s8: The coordinator controls step navigation; the reporter records contributions.

steps.s1: Chat is integrated into the session and enables real-time discussions among all participants.
steps.s2: Messages are linked to the active session and can be reviewed in history.

steps.s1: Use the whiteboard to create shapes, arrows, and text to visually document discussions.
steps.s2: Drag and drop elements to collaboratively organize content.
steps.s3: Share the whiteboard in chat so everyone can see the current state of the discussion.

steps.s1: The coordinator can start, pause, and reset the timer, which is visible to all participants.
steps.s2: The timer is synced in real-time, ensuring everyone sees the same time.

steps.s1: The professor defines evaluation criteria by phase (Opening/Closing) when configuring the room.
steps.s2: During the session, the professor assigns grades (E/VG/G/S/I) for each student per criterion.
steps.s3: Evaluations can be archived by problem to generate comparative reports.

steps.s1: Students can evaluate themselves and their peers using the same criteria as the professor.
steps.s2: Peer evaluations are recorded and can be reviewed in reports.

steps.s1: The AI Co-tutor assists the professor with question suggestions, glossary, and interventions during the session.
steps.s2: Based on the active scenario, AI provides relevant context and guidance to facilitate tutoring.

steps.s1: Learning objectives are created during sessions and stored in the module bank.
steps.s2: Professors can mark objectives as essential and link them to specific sessions.

steps.s1: Access Reports in the sidebar to view student performance by room.
steps.s2: Progress charts by problem show each student's growth over time.
steps.s3: Export reports as PDF using Ctrl+P to share with coordination.

steps.s1: Manage Institutions: create and configure institutions with custom name and colors (branding).
steps.s2: Manage Courses: create courses linked to institutions and organize by modules.
steps.s3: Manage Users: register professors and students with specific roles.
steps.s4: Manage Groups: create groups and assign students to organize PBL rooms.
steps.s5: Manage Scenarios: create, edit, and associate clinical scenarios to modules and courses.

steps.s1: Admin: full platform access, manages institutions, courses, users, groups, and scenarios.
steps.s2: Professor: creates rooms, manages PBL sessions, evaluates students, and accesses reports.
steps.s3: Student: accesses rooms, participates in PBL sessions, contributes in chat and whiteboard, and does peer evaluations.

steps.s1: The platform is available in Portuguese, English, and Spanish.
steps.s2: Change the language by clicking the flags in the sidebar or on the landing page.
